meanings.definition: To manage or supervise the distribution of something
meanings.sent1: She is administering the snacks to the children at the party.
meanings.sent2: The nurse is administering the vaccines to the patients in the clinic.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was administering the crayons like a magician pulling rabbits out of a hat.
meanings.sent4: The team captain is administering instructions to the players like a conductor leading an orchestra.
meanings.sent5: The chef was administering the spices to the dish with precision and care.

meanings.definition: To give or apply something, such as a medication
meanings.sent1: He is administering the medicine to his sick dog.
meanings.sent2: The doctor is administering the flu shot to the patient.
meanings.sent3: The robot was administering oil to its joints to keep moving smoothly.
meanings.sent4: The gardener is administering water to the plants like a lifeline.
meanings.sent5: The artist was administering paint to the canvas with delicate strokes.

meanings.definition: To carry out or perform a task or duty
meanings.sent1: The police officer is administering justice in the community.
meanings.sent2: She is administering first aid to the injured hiker.
meanings.sent3: The robot was administering tasks around the house like a helpful assistant.
meanings.sent4: The leader is administering guidance to the team like a beacon in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The chef was administering the cooking process with expertise and flair.
